function.name: diag
function.short: Diagonal matrices and diagonals of a matrix.

long.para: diag(X) returns the diagonal elements of the quaternion matrix X. If X is a vector, diag(X) constructs a quaternion diagonal matrix using the elements of the vector as the diagonal elements. The second parameter must be a scalar integer indicating the main diagonal (K = 0), super diagonals (K > 1), or sub diagonals (K < 1).

examples.precode:
>> diag([qi, qj, qk])
ans = 3x3 pure quaternion array
>> show(ans)
ans.X =
1 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
ans.Y =
0 0 0 0 1 0 0 0 0
ans.Z =
0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 1
